intro: Stenospermation angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stenospermation, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
